DOC.brief_summary: This study aim determine normative value oxygen saturation late preterm infant , evaluate frequency hypoxic event infant require caffeine discharge require .
DOC.detailed_description: Apnea prematurity common morbidity among premature infant . Recent study suggest association apnea neurodevelopmental impairment . Our objective determine normative value oxygen saturation late preterm infant -reference group . In infant born 28-35 week require caffeine- study group infant bear 28-35 week require caffeine-control group evaluate frequency hypoxic event . Recruitment time : February 2015 December 2016 . After consent pulse oxymeter place infant 's right wrist . For infant receive caffeine prior discharge , medication institute 12 hour initiation study continue remain hospitalization . For infant , pulse oxymeter do continuously discharge . After discharge , record do home week 46 week correct age three group . All data review blind observer group data come . The data analyze statistician . Normative value develop reference group 46 week post conceptional age . Any medical problem encounter patient study follow 6 month record establish safety caffeine use home discontinuation 44 week post conceptional age .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria infant admit NICU : 1 . Gestational age birth < = 35 week 2 . Families infant live Calgary 3 . Infants discharge home PLC South Health Campus ( SHC ) 4 . Decision treat team start caffeine 5 . No episode clinically significant apnea period 3 5 day prior discharge 6 . Infant access reliable postdischarge follow Exclusion Criteria infant : 1 . Active serious medical condition apnea ( Congenital Heart Disease ( CHD ) , Chronic Lung Disease ( CLD ) , symptomatic anemia ) . 2 . Congenital disorder like Trisomies , genetic syndrome , midline defect , metabolic disorder .
